cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a problem in social choice theory, specifically the facility location problem, which is a well-studied problem in the field. The paper proposes a mechanism for facility location on graphs that is resistant to manipulations by both individuals and coalitions, and is efficient. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Game Theory (cs.GT) sub-category, which deals with the study of strategic interactions between agents. Additionally, the paper proposes a mechanism that can be computed in polynomial time, which suggests that it could also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category, which deals with the study of intelligent agents and their behavior. The paper also deals with graph theory, which suggests that it could belong to the Data Structures (cs.DS) sub-category, which deals with the study of efficient algorithms and data structures. The paper also proposes a mechanism that is Pareto optimal, which suggests that it could belong to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category, which deals with the study of social networks and their properties. Finally, the paper proposes a mechanism that is anonymous, which suggests that it could belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category, which deals with the study of algorithms that can learn from data.
